LootingCorpse.synopsis: Player having a contemplative moment while observing the corpses of dead gnomes.
LootingCorpse.how_to_trigger: 1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. Add a companion using the debug book4. goto -608.96; 0.204; 408.65. Kill the guards standing by the corpses (CTRL-K)6. Loot a deep gnome corpse.If you choose to bow your head in respect Inclusion will follow depending on your companion.

CorpseDisposers.synopsis: Two grouchy duergar, one a talker and one who somewhat mimics/ repeats what his partner says, are responsible for dumping dead gnome bodies into the lake. You can convince them to let you loot the bodies.
CorpseDisposers.how_to_trigger: - loadlevel WLD_Main_A- goto -608.33, 0.39, 405.19- Speak to Viss or Brathwin

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Both sessions involve interacting with dead gnome corpses in the same area but they do so by different means. 'LootingCorpse' involves the player directly looting a corpse after dealing with guards, with a possible respectful moment, while 'CorpseDisposers' involves talking with duergar who dump those same bodies. There is no information suggesting that one must occur as a cause or consequence of the other, nor is there clear evidence that choosing one prevents the other from occurring. As such, there are no explicit ordering or mutual exclusiveness constraints in the provided data.

LootingCorpse_4.speaker: Narrator
LootingCorpse_4.text: *Deep gnomes - killed under the yoke of slavers.*
LootingCorpse_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Panning over small field of dead bodies.

LootingCorpse_6.speaker: Player
LootingCorpse_6.text: I will take the lives of those who took yours.

LootingCorpse_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Play bows their head, hands clasped, respecting the dead.

LootingCorpse_7.speaker: Lae'zel
LootingCorpse_7.text: Revolting. Corpses carry disease - they must be buried or burned.

LootingCorpse_1.speaker: Shadowheart
LootingCorpse_1.text: Really? Save your prayers for someone who at least had the spine to fight back.

LootingCorpse_5.speaker: Karlach
LootingCorpse_5.text: They deserved better than they got. May they rest in peace.

LootingCorpse_11.speaker: Astarion
LootingCorpse_11.text: Pray if you want, but they won't thank you for it. The dead are an ungrateful lot.

LootingCorpse_3.speaker: Wyll
LootingCorpse_3.text: Disposed of like rubbish, like scraps. Are there no limits to people's cruelty?

LootingCorpse_10.speaker: Gale
LootingCorpse_10.text: Kill or be killed - so it goes down in the Underdark.

LootingCorpse_9.speaker: Player
LootingCorpse_9.text: No shops on the Fugue Plane. I might just have a look in your pockets.

CorpseDisposers_10.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_10.text: Where's your pickaxe, gnome? Thrinn know you're over here?

CorpseDisposers_36.speaker: Viss
CorpseDisposers_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spits on the groundNodeContext: Said like a threat.

CorpseDisposers_47.speaker: Player
CorpseDisposers_47.text: She asked me to inspect the bodies for anything useful.

CorpseDisposers_96.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_96.text: Get on with it then, and keep quiet.

CorpseDisposers_26.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_26.text: You know - I don't think she did. I think you're trying to escape. We aren't gonna let that happen, are we, Viss?

CorpseDisposers_15.speaker: Viss
CorpseDisposers_15.context: NodeContext: Said matter-of-factly and threateningly, about to start combat.

CorpseDisposers_74.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_74.text: Do what you can, then. Probably ain't much.

CorpseDisposers_71.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_71.text: Thrinn don't believe in mixing work between us and you. No, I think you were trying to escape.

CorpseDisposers_77.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_77.text: What do we do with runaways, Viss?

CorpseDisposers_20.speaker: Viss
CorpseDisposers_20.context: NodeContext: Said as a threat, since htis is about ot start combat.

CorpseDisposers_29.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_29.text: Hold up, ya rat - I asked you a question. Thrinn know you're sniffing around?

CorpseDisposers_88.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_88.text: 'Less you're here to kick some stiffs lake-side, I suggest you bugger off.
CorpseDisposers_88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera first pans acros the field of dead, then focuses on the duergar

CorpseDisposers_73.speaker: Viss
CorpseDisposers_73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spit on the groundNodeContext: He spits on the ground, glowering.

CorpseDisposers_27.speaker: Player
CorpseDisposers_27.text: My friend, I play Goliath Goatball, Moon Hockey, and Pegasus Polo with corpses.

CorpseDisposers_66.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_66.text: Urgh. Hate being taken all literal-like by fancy types like you.

CorpseDisposers_32.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_32.text: We've work to do. Stuff your Pegasus where the rainbow don't shine.

CorpseDisposers_22.speaker: Player
CorpseDisposers_22.text: Grim work. Did you kill them?

CorpseDisposers_34.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_34.text: Nah. Rockfall smashed 'em. Can't have them stinking up the place.

CorpseDisposers_30.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_30.text: The half that weren't crushed are digging the True Soul outta the wreckage.

CorpseDisposers_75.speaker: Player
CorpseDisposers_75.text: I hope you're checking them for loot first?

CorpseDisposers_89.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_89.text: You gotta be kidding. These trash don't have nothing on 'em but rocks.

CorpseDisposers_91.speaker: Narrator
CorpseDisposers_91.text: *You spot a shiny trinket on one of the corpses.*

CorpseDisposers_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reaches for the trinket and lifts it off the corpse, stashing it into their inventory behind the back.

CorpseDisposers_7.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_7.text: Quit sniffin' around. You're starting to get on my nerves.

CorpseDisposers_83.speaker: Narrator
CorpseDisposers_83.text: *You reach for the trinket, but it's already gone.*
CorpseDisposers_83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player crouches and reaches for the corpse, but the trinket has already been taken by another player.

CorpseDisposers_57.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_57.text: Hey, what're you - oh, I get it.

CorpseDisposers_48.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_48.text: Something caught your eye, eh? That's grand. I'd be willing to let you take it, too, for a mere pittance.

CorpseDisposers_31.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_31.text: Tidy. Hope you enjoy a bit of tat, you dolt.

CorpseDisposers_4.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_4.text: Then get your face outta mine.

CorpseDisposers_28.speaker: Player
CorpseDisposers_28.text: I'll finish up here. You're wanted with the others.

CorpseDisposers_41.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_41.text: Thank the Absolute. They're all yours.

CorpseDisposers_98.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_98.text: I ain't goin' 'til Thrinn tells me to go.

CorpseDisposers_85.speaker: Narrator
CorpseDisposers_85.text: *For a moment you thought you'd seen something shining on one of the corpses. Suddenly, it's vanished.*
CorpseDisposers_85.context: CinematicNodeContext: This is for the edge case in which someone steals the trinket in the space of 1 node. Probably will work best as another shot of the corpse, sans glittering metal.

CorpseDisposers_8.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_8.text: Done gawking? Lend a hand or get gone.

CorpseDisposers_0.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The pushing of the corpse into the lake appears to be handled systemnically, so the camera can pan out and let animation take over.

CorpseDisposers_70.speaker: Lae'zel
CorpseDisposers_70.text: At ease. Observe, and learn. Once you are assured victory, then you strike.

CorpseDisposers_46.speaker: Shadowheart
CorpseDisposers_46.text: At least try to find out something of use before you kill them.
CorpseDisposers_46.context: NodeContext: 'violence doesn't always have to be the first option, you know'

CorpseDisposers_80.speaker: Karlach
CorpseDisposers_80.text: Ooh, are we killing slavers? Me first!

CorpseDisposers_40.speaker: Astarion
CorpseDisposers_40.text: There's a time and a place for violence. I mean - this place is perfect, but is it the time?

CorpseDisposers_81.speaker: Wyll
CorpseDisposers_81.text: Go on - get it done. You've got me at your side.
CorpseDisposers_81.context: NodeContext: In a low voice. Said to player, doesn't want others to hear.

CorpseDisposers_23.speaker: Gale
CorpseDisposers_23.text: Whoa, not so fast. Let's get the lay of the land before we settle on the scorched earth routine.

CorpseDisposers_97.speaker: Player
CorpseDisposers_97.text: Put your back into it. Lazy bastards.

CorpseDisposers_60.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_60.text: Sod off, chum. I put more back in and I'm likely to break it.

CorpseDisposers_87.speaker: Player
CorpseDisposers_87.text: Sounds like a lark. I reckon I could kick a corpse farther than you.

CorpseDisposers_5.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_5.text: It was a figure of speech, you lummox. We ain't looking for help.

CorpseDisposers_68.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_68.text: Ain't looking for company neither. Take a walk - go find yerself a minotaur to wrestle or something.

CorpseDisposers_25.speaker: Player
CorpseDisposers_25.text: I've heard of many burial rites and last wishes in my time. Being tossed into fetid water is not one of them.

CorpseDisposers_84.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_84.text: This ain't no funeral - this is taking out the rubbish. They served their purpose, and now they're fish food.

CorpseDisposers_18.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers_18.text: That's about the best end you can expect if you don't turn to the Absolute.
